thread.title: Strong earthquake hits south-west of Fiji - The Sydney Morning Herald
thread.title_full: Strong earthquake hits south-west of Fiji - The Sydney Morning Herald

title: Strong earthquake hits south-west of Fiji - The Sydney Morning Herald
text:
Strong earthquake hits south-west of Fiji 65 reading now twitter TWEET More 
A tsunami threat to Fiji has been cancelled, shortly after a powerful earthquake struck off the South Pacific island nation, prompting many panicked coastal residents to evacuate to higher ground, the Pacific Tsunami Warning Centre says. 
The quake, which hit at 10.52am (8.52am AEST), was centred 280 km southwest of Fiji's capital, Suva, at a shallow depth of about 15 kilometres, the US Geological Survey said. 
A 3.9 magnitude tremor was felt in south west Sydney. Vision: Seven News Up Next Government's robo debt recovery Government's robo debt recovery 
The machine relied on by the government to recover welfare overpayments has actually misapplied the law. The Age's Economics Editor Peter Martin explains. Up Next Six habits of highly organised people Play Video Six habits of highly organised people 
Ditch the complicated organisational tools, get back to basics with these tips for a great year. Up Next People are suicidal: Wilkie People are suicidal: Wilkie 
Letters are being wrongly sent by Centrelink to people saying they owe the Government money and it's so frightening to some, they're even suicidal according to Independent MP Andrew Wilkie. Courtesy ABC News 24. Up Next Cystic fibrosis drug stalled by price talks Play Video Cystic fibrosis drug stalled by price ... Cystic fibrosis drug stalled by price talks 
30 Australian children with cystic fibrosis are unable to access a 'game-changing' drug due to stalled negotiations between the government and an American drug company. Up Next Abbott not helpful: Joyce Abbott not helpful: Joyce 
The former PM's recent comments including advice to Coalition colleagues isn't doing the party any favours according to the Deputy PM. Courtesy ABC. Up Next New citizenship test New citizenship test 
Australia should consider changing the citizenship test to focus more on values such as working and educating children, rather than being so trivia based, according to the Immigration Minister. 
A 3.9 magnitude tremor was felt in south west Sydney. Vision: Seven News 
It was originally recorded with a magnitude of 7.2 but was later downgraded to 6.9. 
There were no initial reports of widespread casualties or damage. Related Content 
Fiji's national disaster office issued a nationwide tsunami warning after the powerful underwater quake, leading to widespread evacuations and traffic jams. 
At least two aftershocks with magnitudes of more than 5 rattled Fiji soon after the quake. Advertisement 
The Pacific Tsunami Warning Centre cancelled the tsunami threat to Fiji just over an hour after the first tremor. 
"The earthquake caused a fair bit of panic; there are cars lined up trying to get to higher ground," Jovesa Saladoka, the Fiji director of Oxfam, told Reuters by telephone from Suva. SHARE An earthquake of magnitude 7.2 has shaken Fiji. Photo: USGS 
Corrine Ambler, a Red Cross worker in Suva, said on Twitter all Red Cross staff and most of the capital was "headed to higher ground". 
An Australian tourist in Fiji said things got a bit "crazy" after the earthquake. 
Sydneysider Dan Bennett was near the pool of his waterfront hotel in the capital of Suva at the time but did not feel any tremor. He was told by staff to pack up and prepare to evacuate. "Everything outside is pretty crazy - there's sirens going off and there's cops everywhere," he told AAP. "I didn't feel the quake. I was just reading about it on Twitter and then sirens started going off." A number of people reported on social media feeling the quake, from Suva to Nadi, and Sigatoka on the main island's southern coast. Pictures were posted of locals and holidaymakers moving to higher ground. Local Kelvin Anthony's office in Suva was briefly evacuated but workers were allowed to return shortly after. "It was an hour 30 minutes of rush and then we are back in office. Sipping coffee. Eating cake. Hustling," he tweeted. Reuters, AAP
